short_summary: Service delivery and coordination for Stream to Sea Program in Northern Vancouver Island, Canada
description: Fisheries and Oceans, Canada, requires contractors to provide delivery and coordination services for the Stream to Sea Program, as defined by the Community Advisor, for: - Northern Vancouver Island The contractor will work with the Community Advisor(s), to coordinate and deliver the Stream to Sea Program in schools and with local community groups.",
full_summary:
### Program: Stream to Sea Program Delivery and Coordination Services

#### Request for Proposal (RFP) Notification

The Fisheries and Oceans, Canada, is soliciting proposals from qualified contractors to provide delivery and coordination services for the Stream to Sea Program on Northern Vancouver Island. 

#### Program Objective
The Stream to Sea Program aims to develop opportunities for external parties to be involved in developing education and outreach initiatives related to salmon and aquatic ecosystems. The contractor will work closely with the Community Advisor to coordinate and deliver the program in schools and with local community groups.

#### Scope of Work
The contractor will be responsible for the following tasks:

* Coordinating and delivering the program in schools and with localcommunity groups
* Providing classroom sessions on topics such as the salmon life cycle, fish dissections, aquatic ecosystems and habitat requirements for salmon, environmental sustainability and other salmon-focused education pertinent to the subject.
* Troubleshooting and maintenance support for aquaria in schools.
* Developing and delivering the spring fry release program for participating schools
* Facilitating and developing opportunities with local communities, First Nations and community groups.

#### Required Skills and Experience
* Experience in delivering educational programs related to aquatic ecosystems and salmon
* Ability to work in a team environment
* Ability to work with local communities, First Nations and community groups
* Strong communication and project management skills

#### Proposal Submission
Bidders are required to submit their proposal electronically through the Merx website.

#### Contact Information
For more information, please contact Claire Lavoie, Acquisition Specialist, at:
	* Email: [DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)
	* Phone: 506-282-2340

#### Attachments
The RFP document can be found on the Merx website.
